newsitem.title: USA: Willbros to manage Great Lakes Pipeline.
newsitem.headline: Willbros to manage Great Lakes Pipeline.

text.p: Willbros Group Inc said Monday one of its operating units has been awarded a contract by Great Lakes Gas Transmission LP to manage its recently announced $2.5 billion project to construct about 1,000 miles of pipeline and associated compression facilities.

Willbros said the value of its services is expected to be in excess of $15 million. Under Great Lakes planned filing with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission in September 1997, Wilbros will provide project management services as well as engineering, survey, right-of-way acquisition, procurement and construction management services for the planned project.
The partnership is equally owned by a subsidiary of The Coastal Corporation and TransCanada PipeLines Ltd.

The planned 42-inch pipeline will originate at an interconnection with TransCanada PipeLines at the Minnesota-Manitoba border and will generally parallel Great Lakes' existing system to an interconnection with TransCanada near St. Clair, Mich. The project will add up to 2 billion cubic feet of natural gas per day of additional capacity to Great Lakes' system and service is expected to begin by the winter of 1999 - 2000.
